llm.feedback: The draft is overly verbose and drifts into mortgage‑rate and equity‑market territory that is irrelevant to the UST 10‑year focus.  Remove any reference to mortgage rates, the S&P 500, or other assets, or explicitly tie them back to the 10‑year via a clear causal chain (e.g., “a 10‑year rise pushes mortgage spreads higher”).  Condense the brief to 4–6 concise bullets, each anchored to the ust10y handle, with inline citations for every quantitative claim: 4.10–4.15 % after the 25‑bp cut (U21K4ALYQ), 4.20–4.25 % if core PCE stays at 2.6 % (97MD1FHW8), 4.40–4.50 % if tariffs persist (1DEM6P1Y2).  Explicitly state the transmission: Fed cut → 2‑yr drop → spread compression → 10‑yr decline (U21K4ALYQ); tariff escalation → inflation expectations → spread widening → 10‑yr rise (1DEM6P1Y2).  List catalysts with dates: Sep 16‑17 FOMC (U21K4ALYQ), late‑Aug core PCE revision (97MD1FHW8), mid‑Oct tariff court ruling (1DEM6P1Y2).  Watch items: Fed minutes, core PCE, tariff ruling, 2‑yr/10‑yr spread, tech‑sector futures (3YAQ8JUPL).  Ensure no generic platitudes; each bullet should quantify a range, a catalyst, and a risk, all with the appropriate citation.
